revised_title: Exploring DNA Conformational Flexibility and its Implications in Chromatin Organization
tldr: The authors describe a conformational flexibility in DNA structure that allows it to kink and bend, which may play a role in organizing DNA within the nucleosome structure in chromatin. They propose a left-handed superhelical DNA structure that could be involved in the organization of DNA within the nucleosome structure in chromatin. This flexibility could also explain enhanced rates of tritium exchange and reactivity of double-stranded DNA to formaldehyde.
